noun.description: A loop with a running knot, tightening as the rope or wire is pulled and typically used to hang people or trap animals.

examples: she was noosed and hooded, then strangled by the executioner

phrases: This was the awakening, the realization that I had officially and for all time put my head in a noose and the hangman was taking his sweet time.
origin: Late Middle English: probably via Old French no(u)s from Latin nodus knot.
